data.title: ARC Productions - ARC
data.meta_description: ARC works collaboratively with many artists and companies to produce work that is relevant to our audiences. Here you can find out more about both past and current productions.
data.text:
ARC acts as a producer for some of our Associate Artists and Companies, supporting them to make, present and tour work. Each year we tour 3 – 4 shows to venues across the UK.

Past productions include:

Daniel Bye

The Price of Everything (Edinburgh Festival, UK and international tour, 2012-2018)

How to Occupy an Oil Rig (Edinburgh & UK tour, 2013-2014)

Story Hunt (UK-wide, 2012-2015)

Error 404 (Polka Theatre, London, 2015 & UK tour, 2015-2018)

Going Viral (Edinburgh Festival, UK and international tour, 2015-2019)

Tiny Heroes (UK-wide, 2016-2019)

Instructions for Border Crossing (Edinburgh Festival, UK & international tour 2017-2018)

Arthur (Edinburgh Festival 2019)

These Hills Are Ours (with Boff Whalley) (UK tour 2021/22)

Kathryn Beaumont

I Told You This Would Happen (UK tour 2014/2015)

Jack Bennett

Too Much Too Young (UK tour 2014/2015)

Winners (2015)

Umar Butt

Alex and Eliza (2018, UK tour, 2019)

Welcome to the Jungle (2021/22)

Mike Edwards

The Life and Deaths of Dominic Stratton (2010/2011)

The Trails of an Invisible Man (2012)

Damn Seagulls (2019-20)

Full Circle (in partnership with Little Cog)

The Lab (2014)

Los Muertos (2015)

Out of the Shadows (2016)

The Keepers (2017)

In The Middle Of Our Street (North East tour 2019)

Stomping Ground (2021-23)

Holly Gallagher

Tensile Strength (or How to Survive at Your Wit’s End) (2018/2019)

Kate Fox

Kate Fox News (UK tour, 2010/2011)

The Starting Line (UK tour 2012)

Claire Murphy-Morgan

Editor (UK tour 2013)

Luca Rutherford

Learning How to Die (2015, UK tour 2016/2017)

Luca Rutherford’s Political Party (2017, UK tour 2018/19)

You Heard Me / You Heard Us (UK tour 2021)

Scott Turnbull

Where Do All the Dead Pigeons Go? (Edinburgh festival & UK tour 2017)

Tales from the Smog (2018/2019, UK tour 2020/21)

Tom Walton

When We Embraced (Edinburgh Festival & UK tour, 2013)

Vici Wreford-Sinnott

Butterfly (2016, UK tour 2017)

Another England (2018, UK tour 2019)

Current Productions Include:

Daniel Bye

Imaginary Friends (in development 2023)

Umar Butt

What is Love? (2023)

Welcome to the Jungle (touring 2024)

Full Circle

Autobiography (in development 2023)

Holly Gallagher

The Silliness Project (in development 2022-23)

Luca Rutherford

You Heard Me (autumn tour 2023)

Scott Turnbull
